intro: Noccaea rosularis, commonly known as the rock白菜 or the stone cabbageweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its basal rosette of small, fleshy leaves. It produces small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Noccaea rosularis is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cooler, moist environments.
